snippet: Devyani Khobragade, an Indian diplomat, was indicted on charges of visa fraud and making false statements in connection with her treatment of a domestic worker.
abstract: Legal battle over Indian diplomat Devyani Khobragade takes unusual turn; she is indicted by federal grand jury in Manhattan on charges of visa fraud and making false statements in connection with treatment of domestic worker Sangeeta Richard, but is then told by State Dept, which had granted her diplomatic immunity, to leave United States; moves suggest that separate understanding had been reached with other United States officials with goal of relaxing tensions with India.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon and Colin Moynihan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Devyani Khobragade, an Indian diplomat, was indicted on charges of visa fraud and making false statements in connection with her treatment of a domestic worker.

headline.main: After Being Indicted, Diplomat Is Allowed to Leave the Country
headline.print_headline: After Being Indicted, Diplomat Is Allowed To Leave the Country
